005package edu.wpi.first.math.system.plant;
006
007import edu.wpi.first.math.Matrix;
008import edu.wpi.first.math.Nat;
009import edu.wpi.first.math.VecBuilder;
010import edu.wpi.first.math.numbers.N1;
011import edu.wpi.first.math.numbers.N2;
012import edu.wpi.first.math.system.LinearSystem;
013
014public final class LinearSystemId {
015  private LinearSystemId() {
016    // Utility class
017  }
018
019  /**
020   * Create a state-space model of an elevator system. The states of the system are [position,
021   * velocity]ᵀ, inputs are [voltage], and outputs are [position].
022   *
023   * @param motor The motor (or gearbox) attached to the arm.
024   * @param massKg The mass of the elevator carriage, in kilograms.
025   * @param radiusMeters The radius of thd driving drum of the elevator, in meters.
026   * @param G The reduction between motor and drum, as a ratio of output to input.
027   * @return A LinearSystem representing the given characterized constants.
028   * @throws IllegalArgumentException if massKg &lt;= 0, radiusMeters &lt;= 0, or G &lt;= 0.
029   */
030  @SuppressWarnings("ParameterName")
031  public static LinearSystem<N2, N1, N1> createElevatorSystem(
032      DCMotor motor, double massKg, double radiusMeters, double G) {
033    if (massKg <= 0.0) {
034      throw new IllegalArgumentException("massKg must be greater than zero.");
035    }
036    if (radiusMeters <= 0.0) {
037      throw new IllegalArgumentException("radiusMeters must be greater than zero.");
038    }
039    if (G <= 0) {
040      throw new IllegalArgumentException("G must be greater than zero.");
041    }
042
043    return new LinearSystem<>(
044        Matrix.mat(Nat.N2(), Nat.N2())
045            .fill(
046                0,
047                1,
048                0,
049                -Math.pow(G, 2)
050                    * motor.KtNMPerAmp
051                    / (motor.rOhms
052                        * radiusMeters
053                        * radiusMeters
054                        * massKg
055                        * motor.KvRadPerSecPerVolt)),
056        VecBuilder.fill(0, G * motor.KtNMPerAmp / (motor.rOhms * radiusMeters * massKg)),
057        Matrix.mat(Nat.N1(), Nat.N2()).fill(1, 0),
058        new Matrix<>(Nat.N1(), Nat.N1()));
059  }
060
061  /**
062   * Create a state-space model of a flywheel system. The states of the system are [angular
063   * velocity], inputs are [voltage], and outputs are [angular velocity].
064   *
065   * @param motor The motor (or gearbox) attached to the flywheel.
066   * @param jKgMetersSquared The moment of inertia J of the flywheel.
067   * @param G The reduction between motor and drum, as a ratio of output to input.
068   * @return A LinearSystem representing the given characterized constants.
069   * @throws IllegalArgumentException if jKgMetersSquared &lt;= 0 or G &lt;= 0.
070   */
071  @SuppressWarnings("ParameterName")
072  public static LinearSystem<N1, N1, N1> createFlywheelSystem(
073      DCMotor motor, double jKgMetersSquared, double G) {
074    if (jKgMetersSquared <= 0.0) {
075      throw new IllegalArgumentException("J must be greater than zero.");
076    }
077    if (G <= 0.0) {
078      throw new IllegalArgumentException("G must be greater than zero.");
079    }
080
081    return new LinearSystem<>(
082        VecBuilder.fill(
083            -G
084                * G
085                * motor.KtNMPerAmp
086                / (motor.KvRadPerSecPerVolt * motor.rOhms * jKgMetersSquared)),
087        VecBuilder.fill(G * motor.KtNMPerAmp / (motor.rOhms * jKgMetersSquared)),
088        Matrix.eye(Nat.N1()),
089        new Matrix<>(Nat.N1(), Nat.N1()));
090  }
091
092  /**
093   * Create a state-space model of a DC motor system. The states of the system are [angular
094   * position, angular velocity], inputs are [voltage], and outputs are [angular position, angular
095   * velocity].
096   *
097   * @param motor The motor (or gearbox) attached to the DC motor.
098   * @param jKgMetersSquared The moment of inertia J of the DC motor.
099   * @param G The reduction between motor and drum, as a ratio of output to input.
100   * @return A LinearSystem representing the given characterized constants.
101   * @throws IllegalArgumentException if jKgMetersSquared &lt;= 0 or G &lt;= 0.
102   */
103  @SuppressWarnings("ParameterName")
104  public static LinearSystem<N2, N1, N2> createDCMotorSystem(
105      DCMotor motor, double jKgMetersSquared, double G) {
106    if (jKgMetersSquared <= 0.0) {
107      throw new IllegalArgumentException("J must be greater than zero.");
108    }
109    if (G <= 0.0) {
110      throw new IllegalArgumentException("G must be greater than zero.");
111    }
112
113    return new LinearSystem<>(
114        Matrix.mat(Nat.N2(), Nat.N2())
115            .fill(
116                0,
117                1,
118                0,
119                -G
120                    * G
121                    * motor.KtNMPerAmp
122                    / (motor.KvRadPerSecPerVolt * motor.rOhms * jKgMetersSquared)),
123        VecBuilder.fill(0, G * motor.KtNMPerAmp / (motor.rOhms * jKgMetersSquared)),
124        Matrix.eye(Nat.N2()),
125        new Matrix<>(Nat.N2(), Nat.N1()));
126  }
127
128  /**
129   * Create a state-space model of a differential drive drivetrain. In this model, the states are
130   * [v_left, v_right]ᵀ, inputs are [V_left, V_right]ᵀ and outputs are [v_left, v_right]ᵀ.
131   *
132   * @param motor the gearbox representing the motors driving the drivetrain.
133   * @param massKg the mass of the robot.
134   * @param rMeters the radius of the wheels in meters.
135   * @param rbMeters the radius of the base (half the track width) in meters.
136   * @param JKgMetersSquared the moment of inertia of the robot.
137   * @param G the gearing reduction as output over input.
138   * @return A LinearSystem representing a differential drivetrain.
139   * @throws IllegalArgumentException if m &lt;= 0, r &lt;= 0, rb &lt;= 0, J &lt;= 0, or G &lt;= 0.
140   */
141  @SuppressWarnings({"LocalVariableName", "ParameterName"})
142  public static LinearSystem<N2, N2, N2> createDrivetrainVelocitySystem(
143      DCMotor motor,
144      double massKg,
145      double rMeters,
146      double rbMeters,
147      double JKgMetersSquared,
148      double G) {
149    if (massKg <= 0.0) {
150      throw new IllegalArgumentException("massKg must be greater than zero.");
151    }
152    if (rMeters <= 0.0) {
153      throw new IllegalArgumentException("rMeters must be greater than zero.");
154    }
155    if (rbMeters <= 0.0) {
156      throw new IllegalArgumentException("rbMeters must be greater than zero.");
157    }
158    if (JKgMetersSquared <= 0.0) {
159      throw new IllegalArgumentException("JKgMetersSquared must be greater than zero.");
160    }
161    if (G <= 0.0) {
162      throw new IllegalArgumentException("G must be greater than zero.");
163    }
164
165    var C1 =
166        -(G * G) * motor.KtNMPerAmp / (motor.KvRadPerSecPerVolt * motor.rOhms * rMeters * rMeters);
167    var C2 = G * motor.KtNMPerAmp / (motor.rOhms * rMeters);
168
169    final double C3 = 1 / massKg + rbMeters * rbMeters / JKgMetersSquared;
170    final double C4 = 1 / massKg - rbMeters * rbMeters / JKgMetersSquared;
171    var A = Matrix.mat(Nat.N2(), Nat.N2()).fill(C3 * C1, C4 * C1, C4 * C1, C3 * C1);
172    var B = Matrix.mat(Nat.N2(), Nat.N2()).fill(C3 * C2, C4 * C2, C4 * C2, C3 * C2);
173    var C = Matrix.mat(Nat.N2(), Nat.N2()).fill(1.0, 0.0, 0.0, 1.0);
174    var D = Matrix.mat(Nat.N2(), Nat.N2()).fill(0.0, 0.0, 0.0, 0.0);
175
176    return new LinearSystem<>(A, B, C, D);
177  }
178
179  /**
180   * Create a state-space model of a single jointed arm system. The states of the system are [angle,
181   * angular velocity], inputs are [voltage], and outputs are [angle].
182   *
183   * @param motor The motor (or gearbox) attached to the arm.
184   * @param jKgSquaredMeters The moment of inertia J of the arm.
185   * @param G The gearing between the motor and arm, in output over input. Most of the time this
186   *     will be greater than 1.
187   * @return A LinearSystem representing the given characterized constants.
188   */
189  @SuppressWarnings("ParameterName")
190  public static LinearSystem<N2, N1, N1> createSingleJointedArmSystem(
191      DCMotor motor, double jKgSquaredMeters, double G) {
192    if (jKgSquaredMeters <= 0.0) {
193      throw new IllegalArgumentException("jKgSquaredMeters must be greater than zero.");
194    }
195    if (G <= 0.0) {
196      throw new IllegalArgumentException("G must be greater than zero.");
197    }
198
199    return new LinearSystem<>(
200        Matrix.mat(Nat.N2(), Nat.N2())
201            .fill(
202                0,
203                1,
204                0,
205                -Math.pow(G, 2)
206                    * motor.KtNMPerAmp
207                    / (motor.KvRadPerSecPerVolt * motor.rOhms * jKgSquaredMeters)),
208        VecBuilder.fill(0, G * motor.KtNMPerAmp / (motor.rOhms * jKgSquaredMeters)),
209        Matrix.mat(Nat.N1(), Nat.N2()).fill(1, 0),
210        new Matrix<>(Nat.N1(), Nat.N1()));
211  }
212
213  /**
214   * Identify a velocity system from it's kV (volts/(unit/sec)) and kA (volts/(unit/sec^2). These
215   * constants cam be found using SysId. The states of the system are [velocity], inputs are
216   * [voltage], and outputs are [velocity].
217   *
218   * <p>The distance unit you choose MUST be an SI unit (i.e. meters or radians). You can use the
219   * {@link edu.wpi.first.math.util.Units} class for converting between unit types.
220   *
221   * @param kV The velocity gain, in volts per (units per second)
222   * @param kA The acceleration gain, in volts per (units per second squared)
223   * @return A LinearSystem representing the given characterized constants.
224   * @throws IllegalArgumentException if kV &lt;= 0 or kA &lt;= 0.
225   * @see <a href="https://github.com/wpilibsuite/sysid">https://github.com/wpilibsuite/sysid</a>
226   */
227  @SuppressWarnings("ParameterName")
228  public static LinearSystem<N1, N1, N1> identifyVelocitySystem(double kV, double kA) {
229    if (kV <= 0.0) {
230      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Kv must be greater than zero.");
231    }
232    if (kA <= 0.0) {
233      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Ka must be greater than zero.");
234    }
235
236    return new LinearSystem<>(
237        VecBuilder.fill(-kV / kA),
238        VecBuilder.fill(1.0 / kA),
239        VecBuilder.fill(1.0),
240        VecBuilder.fill(0.0));
241  }
242
243  /**
244   * Identify a position system from it's kV (volts/(unit/sec)) and kA (volts/(unit/sec^2). These
245   * constants cam be found using SysId. The states of the system are [position, velocity]ᵀ, inputs
246   * are [voltage], and outputs are [position].
247   *
248   * <p>The distance unit you choose MUST be an SI unit (i.e. meters or radians). You can use the
249   * {@link edu.wpi.first.math.util.Units} class for converting between unit types.
250   *
251   * @param kV The velocity gain, in volts per (units per second)
252   * @param kA The acceleration gain, in volts per (units per second squared)
253   * @return A LinearSystem representing the given characterized constants.
254   * @throws IllegalArgumentException if kV &lt;= 0 or kA &lt;= 0.
255   * @see <a href="https://github.com/wpilibsuite/sysid">https://github.com/wpilibsuite/sysid</a>
256   */
257  @SuppressWarnings("ParameterName")
258  public static LinearSystem<N2, N1, N1> identifyPositionSystem(double kV, double kA) {
259    if (kV <= 0.0) {
260      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Kv must be greater than zero.");
261    }
262    if (kA <= 0.0) {
263      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Ka must be greater than zero.");
264    }
265
266    return new LinearSystem<>(
267        Matrix.mat(Nat.N2(), Nat.N2()).fill(0.0, 1.0, 0.0, -kV / kA),
268        VecBuilder.fill(0.0, 1.0 / kA),
269        Matrix.mat(Nat.N1(), Nat.N2()).fill(1.0, 0.0),
270        VecBuilder.fill(0.0));
271  }
272
273  /**
274   * Identify a standard differential drive drivetrain, given the drivetrain's kV and kA in both
275   * linear (volts/(meter/sec) and volts/(meter/sec^2)) and angular (volts/(meter/sec) and
276   * volts/(meter/sec^2)) cases. This can be found using SysId. The states of the system are [left
277   * velocity, right velocity]ᵀ, inputs are [left voltage, right voltage]ᵀ, and outputs are [left
278   * velocity, right velocity]ᵀ.
279   *
280   * @param kVLinear The linear velocity gain, volts per (meter per second).
281   * @param kALinear The linear acceleration gain, volts per (meter per second squared).
282   * @param kVAngular The angular velocity gain, volts per (meter per second).
283   * @param kAAngular The angular acceleration gain, volts per (meter per second squared).
284   * @return A LinearSystem representing the given characterized constants.
285   * @throws IllegalArgumentException if kVLinear &lt;= 0, kALinear &lt;= 0, kVAngular &lt;= 0, or
286   *     kAAngular &lt;= 0.
287   * @see <a href="https://github.com/wpilibsuite/sysid">https://github.com/wpilibsuite/sysid</a>
288   */
289  @SuppressWarnings("ParameterName")
290  public static LinearSystem<N2, N2, N2> identifyDrivetrainSystem(
291      double kVLinear, double kALinear, double kVAngular, double kAAngular) {
292    if (kVLinear <= 0.0) {
293      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Kv,linear must be greater than zero.");
294    }
295    if (kALinear <= 0.0) {
296      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Ka,linear must be greater than zero.");
297    }
298    if (kVAngular <= 0.0) {
299      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Kv,angular must be greater than zero.");
300    }
301    if (kAAngular <= 0.0) {
302      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Ka,angular must be greater than zero.");
303    }
304
305    final double A1 = 0.5 * -(kVLinear / kALinear + kVAngular / kAAngular);
306    final double A2 = 0.5 * -(kVLinear / kALinear - kVAngular / kAAngular);
307    final double B1 = 0.5 * (1.0 / kALinear + 1.0 / kAAngular);
308    final double B2 = 0.5 * (1.0 / kALinear - 1.0 / kAAngular);
309
310    return new LinearSystem<>(
311        Matrix.mat(Nat.N2(), Nat.N2()).fill(A1, A2, A2, A1),
312        Matrix.mat(Nat.N2(), Nat.N2()).fill(B1, B2, B2, B1),
313        Matrix.mat(Nat.N2(), Nat.N2()).fill(1, 0, 0, 1),
314        Matrix.mat(Nat.N2(), Nat.N2()).fill(0, 0, 0, 0));
315  }
316
317  /**
318   * Identify a standard differential drive drivetrain, given the drivetrain's kV and kA in both
319   * linear (volts/(meter/sec) and volts/(meter/sec^2)) and angular (volts/(radian/sec) and
320   * volts/(radian/sec^2)) cases. This can be found using SysId. The states of the system are [left
321   * velocity, right velocity]ᵀ, inputs are [left voltage, right voltage]ᵀ, and outputs are [left
322   * velocity, right velocity]ᵀ.
323   *
324   * @param kVLinear The linear velocity gain, volts per (meter per second).
325   * @param kALinear The linear acceleration gain, volts per (meter per second squared).
326   * @param kVAngular The angular velocity gain, volts per (radians per second).
327   * @param kAAngular The angular acceleration gain, volts per (radians per second squared).
328   * @param trackwidth The width of the drivetrain in meters.
329   * @return A LinearSystem representing the given characterized constants.
330   * @throws IllegalArgumentException if kVLinear &lt;= 0, kALinear &lt;= 0, kVAngular &lt;= 0,
331   *     kAAngular &lt;= 0, or trackwidth &lt;= 0.
332   * @see <a href="https://github.com/wpilibsuite/sysid">https://github.com/wpilibsuite/sysid</a>
333   */
334  @SuppressWarnings("ParameterName")
335  public static LinearSystem<N2, N2, N2> identifyDrivetrainSystem(
336      double kVLinear, double kALinear, double kVAngular, double kAAngular, double trackwidth) {
337    if (kVLinear <= 0.0) {
338      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Kv,linear must be greater than zero.");
339    }
340    if (kALinear <= 0.0) {
341      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Ka,linear must be greater than zero.");
342    }
343    if (kVAngular <= 0.0) {
344      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Kv,angular must be greater than zero.");
345    }
346    if (kAAngular <= 0.0) {
347      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Ka,angular must be greater than zero.");
348    }
349    if (trackwidth <= 0.0) {
350      throw new IllegalArgumentException("trackwidth must be greater than zero.");
351    }
352
353    // We want to find a factor to include in Kv,angular that will convert
354    // `u = Kv,angular omega` to `u = Kv,angular v`.
355    //
356    // v = omega r
357    // omega = v/r
358    // omega = 1/r v
359    // omega = 1/(trackwidth/2) v
360    // omega = 2/trackwidth v
361    //
362    // So multiplying by 2/trackwidth converts the angular gains from V/(rad/s)
363    // to V/(m/s).
364    return identifyDrivetrainSystem(
365        kVLinear, kALinear, kVAngular * 2.0 / trackwidth, kAAngular * 2.0 / trackwidth);
366  }
367}
